terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a vendor and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and manage multiple revisions
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants
A software system that runs on remote servers accessed via the internet, rather than being installed locally on individual computers
Pre-designed document formats or structures that provide a consistent starting point for creating new documentation
A series of sequential steps or processes that define how tasks are completed and information flows through an organization
A software system specifically designed for creating, organizing, managing, and sharing technical documentation and knowledge
The practice of adding descriptive keywords or labels to content to make it easier to categorize, search, and retrieve
The process of creating a searchable catalog of content that allows users to quickly locate specific information within large datasets
Non-text content such as images, videos, audio files, and animations that enhance documentation and improve user understanding
Documentation that allows users to engage with content through clickable elements, embedded media, and dynamic features rather than static text
Built-in capabilities that perform repetitive tasks automatically, such as updating templates or sending reminders, without manual intervention
The process of integrating new employees into an organization by providing them with necessary training, documentation, and resources
The practice of creating consistent formats, structures, and procedures for all documentation to ensure uniformity and quality across an organization
